---
title: "settings.json"
---

## High-level description
This file, `settings.json`, configures Visual Studio Code settings specifically for the `apps/web` directory of a project. It associates `.css` files with the "tailwindcss" language mode, likely for improved syntax highlighting and IntelliSense support when working with Tailwind CSS.

## Symbols
### `files.associations`
#### Description
This setting controls how VS Code associates file extensions with language modes.

#### Internal Logic
It defines a JSON object where keys are file extensions (e.g., `*.css`) and values are the corresponding language modes (e.g., `tailwindcss`).

## Configuration
This file configures a single VS Code setting:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | `files.associations` | Object | N/A | Associates file extensions with specific language modes in VS Code |

This setting specifically maps all `.css` files to be treated as `tailwindcss` files, which enables Tailwind CSS-specific features in the editor.

## Dependencies
This configuration implies the use of Tailwind CSS in the project, as it's setting up VS Code to recognize CSS files as Tailwind CSS files.

| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| Tailwind CSS | A utility-first CSS framework that this configuration is set up to support |

Note: While this configuration file doesn't directly import or use Tailwind CSS, it sets up the editor to work more effectively with Tailwind CSS in the project.
